availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard S. P'Pool (Caldwell county, kentucky, carpenter, 1st lieut. 8th Ky Inf (csa))

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Virginia native. Son of George W. P'Pool and Emily P'Pool. Married to Elizabeth M. McConnell P'Pool in Montgomery County, Tennessee, on October 10, 1860. Father of Alice P'Pool. Student in Mecklenburg County, Virginia, in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Mecklenburg County in 1850. Carpenter in Burnesville in 1860. Served in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a second lieutenant and first lieutenant from October 21, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Mecklenburg County, Regiment 22, p. 120B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Virginia, Mecklenburg County, Regiment 22, p. 35.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Burnesville, p. 17.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Tennessee, p. 534A.
Tennessee State Marriages, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, Montgomery County Marriages, 1838-1874, p. 102.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 122, 380.
"Richard S. Pool (1840-1909)," Find A Grave, Memorial #18386274, accessed January 7, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18386274.
